media.title:
A kinetic installation simulating movement caused by wind. A part of the artist's 'Duplication of Nature' project, which postulates that nature will disappear after the extreme development of technology, and tries to capture data from natural environment to be learned, imitated and represented through AI technology. #soundon 
Windy Field by @chen.yi_x - 2023 at @jutartmuseum

An ever-changing cloud that materializes radiofrequency waves (2G/3G/4G/5G mobile telephony, FM radio, TV, etc.) in public spaces.
Ombres Blanches by @lab212_ - 2023 at Jardin des Plantes

An inflatable sculpture that unfurls with you pedalling on an attached cycling mechanism.
GoÃ©mons by @dynamorphe - 2020

A simulation of a forest in nature, gathering the beep sounds of old mechanical devices. Each electronic light-sound device has a light sensor on the circuit, it makes the sound of a grass bug made of beep responding to hand-drawing animation projected by a projector.
Beepscape for Walla by @hothonam @kisoon.eom @haejin_jung_ - 2023 at @zer01ne.zone #soundon

An animatronic work to combine sculpture and performance that elicits the viewer to become activated in their bodies and therefore present.
Body Sculpture by @jordanmatthewwolfson - 2023 at @nationalgalleryaus

Sited in an existing aperture, two archway forms of the same size pass air back and forth all day long. As one arch inflates the other collapses and air to fill the engorging arch is sucked from the other. The two arches are in mirrored orientation, participants can pass through the bottom arch until it becomes volatile and the upper up-side-down arch starts to displace its counterpart.
Snowballing Doorway by @alex.schweder - 2008 at #WarehouseGallery

*NOW SHOWING*
Interactive âskinsâ that move subtly, reacting on sound and movements in the environment.
Stimulus by @barthess - 14 October 2023 to 7 April 2024 at @textielmuseum #IsItAlive

This machine was inspired by dreaming about gear ratios and implications of exponential powers. Each worm/worm gear pair reduces the speed of the motor by 1/50th. Since there are 12 pairs of gears, the final speed reduction is (1/50) to the 12th power. 

With the motor turning at around 200 revolutions per minute, it will take over two trillion years before the final gear can make but one turn. Consequently, it is possible to do anything at all with the final gear, even embed it in concrete, and the machine will run just fine.

Machine with Concrete by @arthurganson

The interplay between ephemeral coloured light surfaces and outlines creates a compelling visual narrative inspired by baroque two-point perspective studies, encouraging viewers to embrace the idea of constant change and to question the supposed supra-temporality of their own perspective.
Fluchtpunkte by @keine_angst - 2023 at @zkmkarlsruhe #soundon

Testing large-scale reflective material and its effects on the installation environment.
MATERIAL TESTS by @boris.acket - 26 October 2023 at @deschoolamsterdam #soundonð

An infrastructural imaginary where an ore of granule particles (silica and iron) is written and read as a granular record. It consists of a coupled machine that reads the ore by performing its erosion and magnetic sorting layer by layer, while simultaneously writing the ore by depositing its residue sediments linearly according to the measured values.

A Habitat of Recognition by @luizzanotello â 2017 at @hfkbremen

A collection of wearable energy generators. Each contraption explores how the body in motion can generate its own clean power.
Power Suits by @isabelandhelen - 22 September 2023 at @vamuseum

A sculptural arrow which continually points at the moon. It was installed temporarily on shorelines and other public locations around New York City. 

Moon Arrow by @_heidi_neilson_ â 2018

*ONGOING*
An installation to visualise the force of gravity with streams of black silicone oil.
Force by @nawa_kohei - from 2022 at @echigo_tsumari

24 modules â each consisting of two solenoids, a metal rail and a metal ball â create a self triggering system, where the metal ball functions as conductor between the rail and the solenoids. The ball closes the circuit and electricity is applied to the solenoid that pushes the ball back to the opposite side. This results in an interplay between the two solenoids and multiple loops with different time delays.

DSD-08AS by @stefan_tiefengraber â 2018

Audiovisual installation with liquid crystal film panels.
ADSUM by @encor_studio - 2023

*NOW SHOWING*
Explore with bubbles the subtle dancing movements of artificial plants in water.
Puwants by @kosei_komatsu @miyoshikensho - 7 July to 10 September 2023 at @asahi_furusato_museum

*UPCOMING*
Perched on 10m high poles, 3 performers create a poetic ritual offering a moment of calm, reflection and wonder.
RoZÃ©O by @ciegratteciel - 9 & 10 September | 3pm & 6.30pm | Tide Square, SE10 0ES at @gdifestival (video by @ladyricart)

An interactive installation that represents plastic waste data from the seas that surround Thailand by way of illustrating the gravity of water. Participants can select the type of plastic waste and place it in the installation, and watch how much plastic waste is found in the sea from 2007 to the present.
Plastic Sea by @witaya_junma â 2021

A display for kinetic typographies and motion graphics by twisting elastic bands.
Hinemosu 30 by @katsumotoy - 2023 at @acmsiggraph

A kinetic sculpture that reveals the fluidity of ordinary sceneries.
New Molecular Cloud by @vincent_leroy_studio - 2023

A bright circle of light emanates, captured by a floating mirrored sphere above.
Inner, Outer, Other by @sebastian_kite - 2022 at @klanglichtgraz

A 16-bit digital audio recording of the Banna creek, which erodes the Pianalto region near Turin, Italy, controls 16 electrovalves suspended above a mass of soil from the region. The mass of soil gradually collapses and melts down over the days, recreating the landscapeâs erosion on a smaller scale.
Sound Fossil III. Lines by Alessandro Perini â 2018 at @fondazionespinolabanna

A ferrofluid audio visualiser that responds to music.
FAV by @dakd_jung - 2021 ongoing

An installation that calls god in 48 languages using Twitter database. The machine monitors the Twitter timeline in real time and when a tweeted text includes the word âgodâ (in various languages), speakers sound "oh my (god in the tweeted language)" at the same time. #soundon 
Oh my ( ) by @noriyuki______suzuki â 2017

*NOW SHOWING*
Immersive installations combining glass and videos to question the body in a virtual world that tends more and more to dematerialise it.
3.5 by @bones_and_clouds - 12 May to 3 September 2023 at @villesoissons

A sound installation that simulates the acoustic quality of rain noise. The hanging drums float in a large cloud-like mobile. Their metallic resonance tubes lift and lower at the heat-sensitive, kinetic nitinol strings, sending and knocking swelling rhythms and rushing harmonies through space.
Pluvial by Kerstin Ergenzinger â 2019

Tiny red dots move through the tube in a particular order from beginning to end. At particular times, we might recognise and perceive symbols â a complex interplay - order in chaos; chaos in order.
BIT.FLOW by #juliuspopp - 2008

Generative artwork with body motions and surrounding movements as input.
Work-in-progress footage by @fingacode - 2023

A sound installation and performance, consisting of everyday objects hung up by strings which oscillate back and forth. The movement of the objects are translated into sound by small gyroscope sensors, which wirelessly send the movement-data to a computer which transforms it into sound. 
OSZILOT by @oszilot â 28 August 2021 at @kunsthauszuerich

A sound installation piece that consists of utilizing a sound wave emission of 30 cycles (right below human beings hearing range) to activate speaker cones with white strings attached to the center of each cone. The work focuses on invisible energy to which we constantly come into encounter in daily life, subsequently drawing attention to the fact that this happens everyday and possibly affect us on various ways without being necessarily aware of the fact that is happening.
30 Cycles of Flux by @garet_ny - 2022 at @pieroatchugarrygallery

A large sheet of paper hangs at the wall, partly curled, rotating over a metal tube. In its slow rotation and the gentle curve, the plane escapes the confines of its two dimensions.
Surface Intervention by @johannes_langkamp - 2021 at @museumvoorlinden

A kinetic sound installation consisting of 36 small robotic actuators playing notes on tuned aluminium bars.
VIBRATIONS by @moritzsimongeist - 2023

Focused rays of ultraviolet light paint temporary landscapes on a layer of phosphorous dust, which emits light up to 30 minutes after being exposed, fading slowly. The canvas keeps a memory of the movements of the laser beam for that time period, where the newest traces are brightest. Everything which has been drawn in the last half hour adds up to the image, creating a much more complex, much more intricate, but only temporary painting.
Phosphor by @studio.robert.henke â 17 March to 4 June 2023 at @thebeamslondon

A geographically accurate view of the cityscape above a moving subway train, projected onto its ceiling, as it moves under New York City.
Uptown Underground byÂ @icallender â October 2019

An architectural pavilion where a mist envelopes the scaffold, mesh structures and human bodies.
Mist Encounter by #SerendipityStudio @lingli_tseng @kwa_architects @is_green - 2017 at @tfam_museum

Future is the fruit of disorder. Based on the principle of an aerodynamic wind tunnel, the machine creates an air sculpture.
Soudain Toujours by @guillaumecousinart - 2023 at @stationmir.interstice

Drops of water fall into a puddle, calming the mind.
Passage to the Lake by @moonseopseo - 2023 at @milan.design.week

A vivid demonstration of chaos theory.
Random | nÂº 37 by @studiopelang - 2023 at @standing_pine

The vibrational energy of music sculpts a pool of water into choreographed waves, transforming water into a kinetic, liquid lens that refracts and reflects light overhead into an ever-shifting lattice of imagery.
Wavespace by @lachlanturczan - 2023 at @milan.design.week

*ONGOING*
A permanent light installation where everyone can change the colours in the tower with their mobile phone, by calling or using an app. The installation is widely visible in south Stockholm; within a radius of approximately ten kilometres.
Colour by Numbers by @loove.ixd @erikkrikortz #MiloLavÃ©n

Suspended objects move and interact to create an ever-evolving landscape, drawing patterns on the wall. The workâs movements are directed by a purpose-built mechanical plotter, tracing Noongar words that have been passed on to Robert during the collection of wood, stone and ochre.â 
Held within a word by @robertandrew_111 â 10 February to 23 April 2023 at @pica_perth

*NOW SHOWING*
Water bursts against the inside of a glass cube. Rushing along these rigid walls, it shapes to its confinement.
To Water Is to Be by @nannosimonis - 1 April to 20 August 2023 at @z33be

A drum string, held tight between two points, played by a strip of film stock looped through a 16mm projector. The strip of celluloid takes on a double role: on the one hand, light is projected through it and creates a diffuse illumination. On the other hand, the film's movement against the drum string creates a silvery sound. 
Wirepiece by @timeasperspective â 2022 at @estherschippergallery (video by @artbeatsberlin )

A sculptural apparatus that is designed to engage with the environment; creating a drawing that captures the winds.

Drawing Machine by Lawrence LaBianca - 2010

An interactive modeling framework for the form-finding of tension-active structures by leveraging force-feedback, motor-communication and elastic material behavior.
EQUILIBRIUM MORPHOLOGIES by @fabian_eidner @alina.turean - 2023 at @itechstuttgart

The sounds through tree trunks were recorded in Beatrixpark, Amsterdam, and amplified in a collective listening space. #soundon
Flora Ex Machina by @andreas.tegnander - 2022 at Kunstkapel, produced by @thewarpperformances

Audio-visual installation performance from the feedback loop of cymatic moving images and a modulated quadraphonic system. #soundon 
Evolution by @pppunko @8ryan.w - 2022

A site-specific, interactive sonic architecture through which visitors move freely, navigating its sounds and noises. This leads to subtle shifts in the perception of space.
Navigating Noise by Kerstin Ergenzinger â 2015/2016

Custom made thermographs as triptychs. Traditionally triptychs were opened and unfolded during special ceremonies as unifying gates or doors between mundane and holy spaces.
XENOPTYX by @ejtech.cc - 18 May to 15 June 2022 at @horizontgaleria

An interactive 3D performance on a curved billboard screen, where anyone passing on the street could gesture to the performer and see her reaction.
Box Body by @jj.agca @x.nw.n (production technique in collaboration w/ @ahad.mahmood) - 2023 at Art-Act Festival

*NOW SHOWING*
Responding to stimulus from the surrounding environment, this pseudo-scientific tool is made with outright precision, yet futile in function. It is part of a series of work that recollects the technological inventions in Raumpatrouille Orion, or Space Patrol Orion, the first German science fiction television series aired in 1966. 
Vision Machine #8 by @bjoern_schuelke - 21 January to 15 March 2023 at @bitforms San Francisco

video_metadata.music_genre: Electronic & Dance Music, Downtempo, Lounge & Ambient Music, Techno Music

media.title:
*NOW SHOWING*
Translucent disks splashed with bold colours overlap with their complementary opposites, giving rise to infinite new colours.
Subtractive Variability by @felipepantone - 17 February to 18 March 2023 at @control.gallery #KOSMOS

Experience temporality and the sense of loss as something beautiful.
Last Fall by @sanderhagelaar - 2022 at @dutchdesignweek

Typeface for the Buddhist scripture, where words are constructed through water drops, dripped by hand one by one. #soundon
Buddhist Sutra Reconstruction by @mr.wimbley - 2020

Here, a physical particle system simulates the visual appearance of computer animations through physical laws. Small particles move, build swarms, attract and repeal from each other on an acrylic tabletop, which gets charged with electrostatic energy from an algorithmically driven matrix of van der graff generators. You can interact with the particles by disturbing the electrostatic field when you touch the screen.
Analog Particle Screen by #RobertMathy - 2013

Small modified and individually programmed thermal printers roam along paper strips that are stretched in different constellations across a space. Like a snail with its trails, the printers leave traces behind, a line, a dot or words, over the course of the exhibition.
Wanderer Spacetime Poetry by Kerstin Ergenzinger â since 2017

Five giant rings dynamically responding to the amplitude and frequency of music.
Implicit Geometry by @whyixd (feat. @natural.kind.spirit) - 2021 at @taipei_music_center

At a time when AI is increasingly used to generate spam content, a group of robotic Spam works together to type out their story. Their porcine prose is generated by a deep-learning-based large language model fine-tuned on a specially altered piggy version of Aldous Huxleyâs Brave New World.
Spambots by @neilmendoza - 2022 at @slomuseumofart

A tableau vivant crafted with pearls, inspired by Chuvash culture.
Pearl mechanisms 3 by @polinatammi - 2022

*UPCOMING*
A website that guides participants and their body movements as they follow instructions on their phones.
www.grindruberairbnb.exposed by @jonathan.chomko - 4 to 7 February at @tangentedanse

A machine that draws straight lines continuously on the paper by snapping the thread with the mechanism of the chalk line tool.
Vague Boundaries by @jonghong.p â 2023

Electronically generated sound is manipulated by a random generator so that only one of the external loudspeakers in the room is activated. The human ear reassembles the acoustic fragments and interprets them as a spatially rhythmic experience through the different angles of incidence. #soundon
Quadrobild extern by Walter Giers â 1971 (video by @zkmkarlsruhe)

A radio telescope listens to electromagnetic waves and translates them into audible frequencies, which are then transribes by an algorithm into midi tones that are reproduced by a self-playing organ. #soundon
Fantasie#1 by @quadrature.co â 2019

*Now Showing*
Small pieces of paper come together and act to move a large paper tube. One of a collection of moving sculptures.
Doshi by @misawadesigninstitute - 10 December 2022 to 5 March 2023 at @tad_toyamakenbi

A 6-metre long shipping container, recycled and made transparent to house an audiovisual performance.
ALCOVE LTD by @encor_studio - 2022 at @fetedeslumieres

A four-voice physical synthesiser. Sound is produced by turning stepper motors that sit on the wooden box. Different objects attached to the motors change the character of the sound. #soundon
Drone Box No. 1 by @kokanikoladze â 2023

A cymatics installation, which is the process of visualising sound and vibrations.
Sonic Water by Sven Meyer & Kim PÃ¶rksen â 25 April to 24. May 2013 at @olympusplayground

14,000 sheets of rice paper, 1,800 pieces of fine bamboo, and 2,000 cotton threads making up this suspended sculpture.
The Ship of Time by #ZhuJinshi - 10 March to 30 April 2018 at @tangcontemporaryart

Two polysensory clothes use the phenomenon of biofeedback to signal psycho-physiological changes taking place in the user's body, like body temperature, galvanic skin response, heart rate or proprioception.
Emotional Clothing by @igaweglinska â 2021

Three revolving long benches, each accommodating up to four people. When you push them in a circle, music gets triggered. 
Placed in the round, the artwork encourages everyone to synchronise their movements in a shared musical experience.
Daydreamer by @dailytlj - 2022

With a parametric speaker attached, an industrial robot arm produces a generative audio sequence from a database of water sounds. #soundon
Water demand will increase by 55% between 2000 and 2050, even as we face freshwater scarcity.
hyd~ by @fabrizio.disalvo (robotics by @nonpostrans) - 2022

*NOW SHOWING*
A prefab palm tree with a top that twirls on a motor and gently sways in the wind.
Parade Paradis by @rachelyoun â August 2022 to august 2023 at @laumeierstl

Words digitally woven into a projected spiderweb get destroyed when visitors pass in front of the work and reconstructs when they have gone. 
Being Not Truthful by @stefansagmeister @ralphammer â 2006 at @acfny

A toy plane orbiting a concrete mixer. The installation expresses that remembering is a present action to construct an abstract narration about the past. #soundon
ÎÏÎµÏÎ¿Î½Î¹Î­ÏÎ± by @anastasis_karras - 2022

Sound robot that creates the contemplative sound of metal balls on various surfaces. #soundon
Hard times - Soft sounds by @moritzsimongeist â 2022

A mechanical device in which sounds are recorded and played back on discarded plastic waste. #soundon
Song from Plastic by @ujoolimheeyoung â 2022

Light shines through fresnel lenses fixed to dimmable motors and becomes modulated into a morphing pattern.
Signalgenertor by @karliaro - 2022 at @kloster.frauenzell

An installation inspired by the vacant airports during the COVID-19 pandemic, when lovers and families became separated and estranged.
Somewhere Nowhere by @rexytseng - 20 August to 13 November 2022 at @tfam_museum #PainandPleasure

A kinetic sculpture of a small, four-and-a-half-inch tall yellow chair that explodes and reconstructs indefinitely.
Coryâs Yellow Chair by @arthurganson â at @mitmuseum

*NOW SHOWING*
Light traces over a perforated fabric to create an endless space, inhabited by hundreds of stars. The perforations reproduce the arrangement of stars to be seen above the artwork at the opening night.
Novae by @lab212_ â 2 October 2022 to 15 January 2023 at @miskartinst

*NOW SHOWING*
Digital artwork projected onto the ephemeral flowing forms of fabric. #soundon
Gravity by @yann.nguema - 9 September to 31 December 2022 at Saint Martin d'Angers

Body powered kinetic sculptures, created with students from @designacademyeindhoven.
Workshop by @isabelandhelen - 2022
